intro: Phlomoides baissunensis, commonly known as the Baissun phlomoides, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, often hairy leaves. It produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. This species is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
